alert.note: Alert for Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 4:44PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Kimball and southeastern Laramie Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 344 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Pine Bluffs, or 27 miles west of Kimball, moving east-southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pine Bluffs, Burns, Panorama Point and Bushnell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 386 and 402. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
